Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Sensors.SpatialSensor.Components

Class CANRange

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Sensors.SpatialSensor.Components.CANRange
All Implemented Interfaces:
RangeSensor
public class CANRange extends Object implements RangeSensor
The CANRange class represents a range sensor that uses a CAN interface for communication. It provides methods for obtaining distance measurements and configuring the sensor.

  • Constructor Details

    • CANRange

      public CANRange(int id, DistanceMode mode, double sampleTime, String busname)
      Constructs a new CANRange sensor instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the range sensor.
      mode - The mode of operation for the sensor (e.g., distance mode).
      sampleTime - The time interval between sensor readings in seconds.
      busname - The CAN bus name (optional, defaults to "rio" if empty).

    • CANRange

      public CANRange(int id, DistanceMode mode, double sampleTime)
      Constructs a new CANRange sensor instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the range sensor.
      mode - The mode of operation for the sensor (e.g., distance mode).
      sampleTime - The time interval between sensor readings in seconds.

  • Method Details

    • getRange

      public double getRange()
      Gets the range (distance) in front of the sensor.
      Specified by:
      getRange in interface RangeSensor
      Returns:
      The distance measured by the sensor in millimeters.

    • configRangeSensor

      public void configRangeSensor()
      Configures the range sensor with default settings. This method applies the basic configuration to the CANrange sensor.
      Specified by:
      configRangeSensor in interface RangeSensor

    • configRangeSensor

      public void configRangeSensor(DistanceMode m)
      Configures the range sensor with a specific distance mode.
      Specified by:
      configRangeSensor in interface RangeSensor
      Parameters:
      m - The desired distance mode (e.g., short, medium, or long).

    • getMode

      public DistanceMode getMode()
      Retrieves the current distance mode of the sensor.
      Specified by:
      getMode in interface RangeSensor
      Returns:
      The current distance mode of the sensor.

    • getOptimalMode

      public DistanceMode getOptimalMode()
      Retrieves the optimal distance mode based on the current sensor reading. The method checks the distance and selects the most appropriate mode.
      Specified by:
      getOptimalMode in interface RangeSensor
      Returns:
      The optimal distance mode for the current range.

    • updateFromDirectional

      public void updateFromDirectional(double translation)
      Updates the sensor's state based on directional translation. This method can be used to adjust sensor settings based on motion.
      Parameters:
      translation - The translation value to adjust the sensor state.
